meanings.definition: The state or quality of being isogonous.
meanings.sent1: In the study of shapes, isogony refers to the equal angles in a figure.
meanings.sent2: The isogony of the triangle made it easier to calculate its missing angles.
meanings.sent3: At the geometry party, the isogony of the shapes made them all get along perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an isogony of thoughts, each angle equally important.
meanings.sent5: The isogony of the circle made it a perfect shape for the design.

meanings.definition: The condition of having equal angles.
meanings.sent1: The isogony of the square made it symmetrical from all angles.
meanings.sent2: The isogony of the parallelogram allowed for precise measurements.
meanings.sent3: The isogony of the clock's hands made it look like they were dancing in sync.
meanings.sent4: In the mirror maze, the isogony of reflections confused the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The isogony of the star's points created a perfect shape in the sky.

meanings.definition: The equality of angles in a polygon.
meanings.sent1: The isogony of the hexagon made it a regular polygon.
meanings.sent2: The isogony of the pentagon allowed for easy construction.
meanings.sent3: The isogony of the polygon's angles made it a favorite among mathematicians.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an isogony of joy, each angle expressing happiness.
meanings.sent5: The isogony of the diamond shape gave it a unique sparkle.
